item.title: John add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "In Moulmein, in lower Burma, I was hated by large numbers of people â€“ the only time in my life that I have been important enough for this to happen to me." -- George Orwell

item.title: John add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "I could see that, if not actually disgruntled, he was far from being gruntled." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: John add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "All animals are equal, but some animals are more equal than others." -- George Orwell

item.title: John add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "All right, then, I'll go to hell." -- Mark Twain

item.title: John add a quote by Patrick O'Brian
item.description: "Jack, you've debauched my sloth." -- Patrick O'Brian

item.title: John add a quote by Patrick O'Brian
item.description: "Authority is a solvent of humanity: look at any husband, any father of a family,and note the absorption of the person by the persona, the individual by the role. Then multiply the family, and the authority, by some hundreds and see the effect upon a sea-captain, to say nothing of an absolute monarch.Surely man in general is born to be oppressed or solitary, if he is to be fully human; unless it so happens that he is immune to the poison. " -- Patrick O'Brian

item.title: John add a quote by Patrick O'Brian
item.description: "Of course I do know it is the French who are so wicked; but there are all these people who keep coming and going - the Austrians, the Spaniards, the Russians. Pray, are the Russians good now? It would be very shocking - treason no doubt - to put the wrong people in my prayers." -- Patrick O'Brian
